creator: ladislav.skokan@ird.eds.com
text:
The PVCS tag is primarly targeted to PVCS versioning system from Merant. There 
is similar product from Merant called "PVCS Dimension" that is extended PVCS by 
CRM functionality. The PVCS tag from optional library does not work with the 
PVCS Dimension product. I have written new tag that we use on daily basis. I 
would like to add the tag into the optional library to be used by other 
developers. If you want the source code and doc please contact me.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
A while ago, Michael Rousey has submitted a bunch of tasks for PVCS dimensions
to ant-dev, see http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-dev&m=101433859413135&w=2

You could do us a big favor if you gave them a try and come back to tell us
whether they work - so we have at least a second user confirming the stuff, which
makes it a lot more likely that it gets committed.

creator: ladislav.skokan@ird.eds.com
text:
I am unable to download attachement from Michael Rousey in the conference 
archive. There is a problem with the zip file.
What I have seen from the discussion, Michael's PVCS Dimension extensions uses 
the "download.exe" utility. The utility has a bug and does checks out files 
properly from PVCS. It does not case of filename properly. So if you 
fetch "DifferentCaseFile.java" , you will get on your 
drive "differentcasefile.java". Of course Java and Apache Ant have problem with 
this. 
Because of the bug, I have used another command-line utility in my extension. I 
have used the "cmdclient.exe" that does not have this bug. My utility does not 
have additional functionality likeMichaels does. It just checks-out (fetches) 
code from the repository. On the other hand, it is state-of-art fetching, 
because you can set-up which directories to fetch, what files to fetch etc. It 
also comapres modified date and fetches just changes agaits repository. It is 
not build-in function of PVCS Dimensions. In our project, there is several tens 
of developers who use it on daily bases.

If you can manage to get the Michaels attachement out of mail archive, I would 
be please to review them.

creator: ladislav.skokan@ird.eds.com
text:
Thanks to Stefan I was able to test the dimenson utilities.
I have tested it on PVCS Dimensions 6.0 and 7.0 on Windows NT against PVCS 
Dimensions Server 6 on Unix database. It generally works, but have some major 
issues, that I think needs to be clarified:
- the "download" utility does not keep proper filename. A 
file "MixesCaseFile.java" will be extracted to local drive with 
filename "mixedcasefile.java". I would set this as a highest priority issue, 
because it is vital for Java compiler to have proper file name. 
- somewhere in doc has to be mentioned, that enviroment variable MCX_SLAVE has 
to be set to point to a login helper. Without the set the "download" utility 
does not login and the task fails.
- for each command from PVCS a GUI window prompts for a password, that I think 
does not match to the Apache Ant strategy of command-line utility. And it is a 
bit annoying ...
- the design of the module is more like to be written for PVCS Dimension 
expert. Tasks like DimensionsFI or DimensionsSCWS reflects to diemnsions 
commands "fi" (fetch item) and "swcs" (set workset) but not to a user who wants 
to use the version manager from a "high-level" perspective. I would suggest to 
redesign the tags to us them like:
<PvcsDimensions>
     <Workset name="MyWorkset@/>
     <Fetch path="/" baseline="MyBeasline">
</PvcsDimensions>
I sent a mail to Michael, asking him to come here and comment.
